actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to provide for a study of the feasibility of allowing individuals, during their working years, voluntarily to make additional contributions to the social security program established by title II of the Social Security Act and during retirement receive additional social security benefits based on such additional contributions.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Requires a one-year study of the feasibility of allowing individuals, during their working years, voluntarily to make additional contributions to the social security program established by title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act and during retirement to receive additional social security benefits based on such additional contributions.

titles.title: A bill to provide for a study of the feasibility of allowing individuals, during their working years, voluntarily to make additional contributions to the social security program established by title II of the Social Security Act and during retirement receive additional social security benefits based on such additional contributions.
